message.body: Hey - how's it going?
Ok, just finishing lunch. Sitting with a friend in the deli but that's no problem, she's on her laptop
U?
A deli in Philly? Which one?
I'm good, just finished some homework for a class I'm taking while at work
The Nosh, 36 & Market. It's not a NY deli (and I grew up there), but it's really good & the people are nice. I know there are kosher delis in Phila, I'v
e seen one in Center City, but I can't remember the name offhand. -- What are you taking?
Oh nice, I always meant to try it. I lived across from lee's when I was at Penn. I was bummed to hear they are closing
Lee's?
I'm taking quantitative methods of econ and business. Hoping to beef up my quant credentials before applying to a grad program for public policy
What do you do in Philly?
Lee's hoagies on walnut between 40 & 41
I work at Penn, at the LDC. I'm a researcher.
Lifelong language geek :-) [My keyboard turned "geek" into "Greek"!]
I don't think I remember Lee's. I might've seen it but not eaten there. (I was never a Penn student, and came down here to work in '02.)
It's only open until the end of the month I think. It was there for almost 30 years
Have you been to koch's on locust and 42
A couple times
But that's not my neighborhood. I go to the CVS a lot, but I live near 45 and Larchwood
So i'm in Atiya Ola's or Milk & Honey fairly often, or the Green Line at 43 & Baltimore, but not Koch's.
Where are you now? Not Philly, I gather.
